content: उच्छ्वसित {%<ab>p. p.</ab>%} (Used actively). {@--1@} Heaving, breathing; <ls>U. 3.</ls> {@--2@} Emitting or sending out vapour (refreshed); <ls>V. 4.</ls> {@--3@} Full-blown, opened, expanded; <ls>Māl. 4</ls>; °मूर्तिः <ls>K. 92</ls> raised up, <ls>Ch. P. 13.</ls> {@--4@} ({%a%}) Enlivened, gladdened, refreshed; <ls>Me. 42.</ls> ({%b%}) Inspired or animated with hope; <ls>Ku. 6. 14.</ls> {@--5@} Breathing a sigh of relief; <ls>M. 3. 6</ls>; <ls>R. 10. 73</ls>; <ls>K. 181.</ls> {@--6@} Consoled; उत्कंठोच्छ्वसितहृदया <ls>Me. 100.</ls> {@--7@} Waving, dishevelled; °अलकं <ls>R. 8. 55.</ls> {@--8@} Effaced (सम्°); <ls>Ku. 3. 38.</ls> --तं {@--1@} Breath, the (very) life; सा कुलपतेरुच्छ्वसितमिव <ls>Ś. 3</ls>; <ls>Ku. 7. 4.</ls> {@--2@} Blooming, blowing. {@--3@} Exhalation; <ls>R. 8. 3.</ls> {@--4@} Heaving, upheaval, throbbing; <ls>R. 6. 68</ls>; <ls>V. 1.</ls> {@--5@} Becoming loose or relaxed. {@--6@} Sighing. {@--7@} The vital airs of the body.
